sen.j: 郡衙（ぐんが）は、日本の古代律令制度のもとで、郡の官人（郡司）が政務をとった役所である。
sen.e: The Gunga (county district offices) was a government office under the kodai Ritsuryosei (ancient East Asian system of centralized governance) in Japan, and government officials [lower or middle ranked, called Gunji (district official)] executed their governmental affairs from the Gunga.

Gunga (county district offices) was a government office attended to the affairs of state by government officials (lower or middle ranked) of the counties (called Gunji) under the kodai Ritsuryosei (ancient East Asian system of centralized governance) in Japan.
sen.cmt: The Gungaの冠詞を取り、under the～を文の最後に持っていき、「郡の官人が～」の部分を修正しました。
sen.e: Gunga (county district offices) was a government office attended to the affairs of state by government officials (lower or middle ranked) of the counties (called Gunji) under the kodai Ritsuryosei (ancient East Asian system of centralized governance) in Japan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 国府や駅とともに地方における官衙施設で、郡家（ぐうけ・ぐんげ・こおげ）・郡院（ぐんいん）という。
sen.e: A Gunga was a kind of Kanga (government office) facility accompanied by a Kokufu (ancient provincial office or capital) and Eki (an ancient station, supporting facilities for a traffic system under Ritsuryo system); this Gunga facility would be called a Gunke (public office, it was pronounced in several ways, Gunke, Gunge, and Kooge) and Gunin.

A Gunga was a kind of Kanga (government office) facility as well as a Kokufu (ancient provincial office or capital) and Eki (an ancient station, supporting facilities for a traffic system under Ritsuryo system) and also pronounced in several ways such as Guuke, Gunge, Kooge and Gunin.
sen.cmt: 「とともに」は「と同様に」の意味と思われるため、accompanied→as well asに修正、this Gunga～を修正しました。
sen.e: A Gunga was a kind of Kanga (government office) facility as well as a Kokufu (ancient provincial office or capital) and Eki (an ancient station, supporting facilities for a traffic system under Ritsuryo system) and also pronounced in several ways such as Guuke, Gunge, Kooge and Gunin.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: また、中国の古制に倣って郡治（ぐんち）とも呼ばれた。
sen.e: Gunga would also have been called a, Gunchi, to emulate the ancient laws of China.
Gunga was also called Gunchi to emulate the ancient laws of China.
sen.cmt: would～→was calledに修正しました。
sen.e: Gunga was also called Gunchi to emulate the ancient laws of China.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 701年に評が郡とされる以前は、評衙（ひょうが）と呼ばれていた。
sen.e: Before Hyo became Gun (county) until year of '701', the Gunga had been called a Hyoga.
Before Hyo became Gun (county) in 701, Gunga had been called Hyoga.
sen.cmt: until year of ‘701’→in 701に修正、冠詞を除きました。
sen.e: Before Hyo became Gun (county) in 701, Gunga had been called Hyoga.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 郡衙施設は郡司が政務にあたる正殿・脇殿から構成される。
sen.e: Gunga facilities were constructed within two main structures: a Seiden (the main buildings of the imperial palace complex), where the Gunji (district official) practiced his political and governmental affaires, and the wakiden (a hall standing nearby the main hall).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Gunga facilities consisted of two main structures: a Seiden (the main buildings of the imperial palace complex) and the wakiden (a hall standing nearby the main hall), where the Gunji (district official) practiced his political and governmental affairs.
sen.cmt: were constructed within→consisted of に、where～の位置を修正、affaires→affairs に修正しました。
sen.e: Gunga facilities consisted of two main structures: a Seiden (the main buildings of the imperial palace complex) and the wakiden (a hall standing nearby the main hall), where the Gunji (district official) practiced his political and governmental affairs.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: ほか、田租・正税出挙稲を保管する正倉、宿泊用の建築などから構成される。
sen.e: Additionally, there were other elements constructed within the Gunga facilities, a shoso (public repository) which maintained the collection of all denso (rice field tax) and a shozei (the rice tax stored in provincial offices' warehouse) and the suikoto (loaned rice plant) and other architectural structures reserved for lodging.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Additionally, it consisted of other elements, such as a shoso (public repository) which maintained the collection of all denso (rice field tax) and a shozei suiko to (loaned rice plant as the rice tax stored in provincial offices' warehouse) and other architectural structures reserved for lodging.
sen.cmt: there were～Gunga facilities→it consisted of～ such asに修正、「正税出挙稲」で一単語かと思われますのでshozei suiko toとして纏めました。その為括弧内の補足部分も少し修正しています。
sen.e: Additionally, it consisted of other elements, such as a shoso (public repository) which maintained the collection of all denso (rice field tax) and a shozei suiko to (loaned rice plant as the rice tax stored in provincial offices' warehouse) and other architectural structures reserved for lodging.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 国司の所在する国府から間接支配程度の統制が行われ、郡司は旧国造などの在地有力豪族であることが多い。
sen.e: Since the Kokufu's initial purpose was the housing of the kokushi (provincial governors) from this location, indirect control was exercised over the territory; a Gunji was often a member from a powerful local family such as kuninomiyatsuko (provincial governor).
Since the Kokufu where kokushi (provincial governors) resided controled Gunga indirectly, most of Gunji were members of powerful local families such as the old kuninomiyatsuko (provincial governor).
sen.cmt: Since～territoryの前半部分を大幅に修正、a Gunji was often～→most of～に修正、「旧国造」→the oldを挿入しました。
sen.e: Since the Kokufu where kokushi (provincial governors) resided controled Gunga indirectly, most of Gunji were members of powerful local families such as the old kuninomiyatsuko (provincial governor).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 国府が整備されるまでは、郡衙がその地域の行政の中心であった。
sen.e: Before the Kokufu was elevated as a governmental facility, the Gunga would be the central administration of a territorial area.
Before the Kokufu was elevated as a governmental facility, the Gunga was the central administration of a territorial area.
sen.cmt: would be→was に修正しました。
sen.e: Before the Kokufu was elevated as a governmental facility, the Gunga was the central administration of a territorial area.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: また、郡域が広域にわたる場合には別院の政治的拠点が存在していたと考えられている。
sen.e: Additionally, historians and experts believe that there must have a betsuin (branch facility, branch temple) for conducting supportive political affairs, in the case a gun's (county) area was too large to manage through a central office.

It is also believed that there was a betsuin (branch facility, branch temple) for conducting supportive political affairs, in case a gun's (county) area was too large to manage through a central office.
sen.cmt: Additionally～believe→It is～there was に修正、in the case→in caseに修正しました。
sen.e: It is also believed that there was a betsuin (branch facility, branch temple) for conducting supportive political affairs, in case a gun's (county) area was too large to manage through a central office.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 郡衙は国府所在地と異なり、郡衙所在地は立郡事情や政治的変遷により移転していることもあり、その特定がなかなか進んでいない。
sen.e: Unlike the location of a Kokufu, the identification process for locating Gunga ruins has not progressed; this is because of two factors: Circumstances of establishment for a Gun (county); and many of the Gunga establishments were relocated during political transitions.

Unlike the location of a Kokufu, process to pinpoint the location of Gunga ruins has not progressed because many of the Gunga establishments were relocated due to circumstances of establishment for a Gun (county) and political transitions.
sen.cmt: the identification～locatingの部分を修正、this is because～をbecause～の形に修正、「移転している」理由が2つ（立郡事情、政治的変遷）だと思われるので、その部分を修正しました。
sen.e: Unlike the location of a Kokufu, process to pinpoint the location of Gunga ruins has not progressed because many of the Gunga establishments were relocated due to circumstances of establishment for a Gun (county) and political transitions.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 近年は考古学における発掘調査の進展や既知の遺跡の再検討がされている。
sen.e: In recent years there has been significant progress made in the excavations, research studies in archaeology, and subsequent reexamination of these well-known ruins.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In recent years the excavation and research has been progressing in archaeology and these well-known remains have been reexamined.
sen.cmt: there has～を「発掘調査」と「既知の遺跡」を主語として修正しました。
sen.e: In recent years the excavation and research has been progressing in archaeology and these well-known remains have been reexamined.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 官衙施設に関係する大型建築跡や墨書土器、祭祀遺物などの出土遺物により、多数の官衙関係遺跡が発見されている。
sen.e: Archeologists and other experts found that many of the ruins related to the Gunga: Findings of massive building construction ruins related to what are Gunga facilities, an ink writing earthenware, and an archaeological find such as Saishi (religious service) vestige were identified.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Many remains related to kanga (government office) have been found by findings of excaveted remains such as massive building construction ruins, an ink writing earthenware and Saishi (religious service) vestige which related to kanga facilities.
sen.cmt: 原文に特にArcheologists and other expertsの記載が無いので除きました。Gungaではなくkanga, archaeological find such as→excaveted remains such as～とし、「官衙施設～祭祀遺物などの」全体がかかっていると思われるので、位置を修正しました。
sen.e: Many remains related to kanga (government office) have been found by findings of excaveted remains such as massive building construction ruins, an ink writing earthenware and Saishi (religious service) vestige which related to kanga facilities.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: これらの成果により、国府と郡衙間、または郡衙と郡衙間を結ぶ古代の交通体系がわかってきている。
sen.e: From these successful discoveries, there were findings of an ancient transportation system between the Kokufu and the Gunga, and between the Gunga and another Gunga.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As a result of these discoveries, an ancient transportation system connected between the Kokufu and the Gunga, and between the Gunga and another Gunga has been emerged.
sen.cmt: From～→As a result～に、「わかってきている」＝明らかになってきているという意味で修正しました。connectedを挿入しました。
sen.e: As a result of these discoveries, an ancient transportation system connected between the Kokufu and the Gunga, and between the Gunga and another Gunga has been emerged.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 9世紀後半頃、国司の権限が大幅に強化され、受領化するとともに、郡司の権限は大幅に縮小され、全国的に郡衙が衰退したことがわかってきている。
sen.e: These ruin findings were proof that around the late ninth century, the kokushi (provincial governors) acquired greater authority and significant power; then began to administrate like a Zuryo (the head of the provincial governors) in their actual practice, and the effect of this fact upon the Gunji was a dramatic reduction in power and authority; so the Gunga system declined in Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: These remains were proof that around the late ninth century, the kokushi (provincial governors) acquired greater authority and significant power and began to administrate like a Zuryo (the head of the provincial governors) in their actual practice, and the effect of this fact upon the Gunji was a dramatic reduction in power and authority so the Gunga system declined in Japan.
sen.cmt: ruin findings→remains, セミコロンを除きました。
sen.e: These remains were proof that around the late ninth century, the kokushi (provincial governors) acquired greater authority and significant power and began to administrate like a Zuryo (the head of the provincial governors) in their actual practice, and the effect of this fact upon the Gunji was a dramatic reduction in power and authority so the Gunga system declined in Japan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: なお、1878年の郡区町村編制法によって編制された近代（明治・大正期）の郡の役所は郡役所と称する。
sen.e: Additionally, in 1878, an office of gun (county) in the modern (Meiji and Taisho) period of Japan, formed by 'Gun-ku-cho-son Henseiho (Act for the alignment of local government system),' was called gunyakusho.

Additionally, an office of gun (county) in the modern period of Japan (the Meiji and Taisho periods), formed by Gun-ku-cho-son Henseiho (Act for the alignment of local government system) enacted in 1878, was called gunyakusho.
sen.cmt: （明治・大正期）の位置を修正、in 1878→enacted in 1878として位置を修正しました。
sen.e: Additionally, an office of gun (county) in the modern period of Japan (the Meiji and Taisho periods), formed by Gun-ku-cho-son Henseiho (Act for the alignment of local government system) enacted in 1878, was called gunyakusho.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
